H0.text: The ratio of 1 tall plant to 3 short plants represents the expected results when Sam and Julia cross a heterozygous tall (Tt) pea plant with a homozygous short (tt) pea plant.

H1.text: 2 tall plants to 2 short plants is the ratio representing the results Sam and Julia can expect when they cross a heterozygous tall (Tt) pea plant with a homozygous short (tt) pea plant in their science classroom.

H2.text: 3 tall plants to 1 short plant is the ratio of plants Sam and Julia can expect when they cross a heterozygous tall (Tt) pea plant with a homozygous short (tt) pea plant in their science classroom.

H3.text: 4 tall plants to 0 short plants is the ratio that Sam and Julia can expect in their science classroom when they cross a heterozygous tall (Tt) pea plant with a homozygous short (tt) pea plant.

A4.text: Probability theory predicts that three quarters of the F2 generation will have the dominant allele's phenotype. And the remaining quarter of the F2s will have the recessive allele's phenotype.

A5.text: He predicted that in this case one-half of the seeds produced would be round (Rr) and one-half wrinkled (rr).
